newsitem.title: GERMANY: Rexrodt -Institutes show Bonn can meet EMU goals.
newsitem.headline: Rexrodt -Institutes show Bonn can meet EMU goals.

text.p: German Economics Minister Guenter Rexrodt said the Spring report of Germany's six leading economic research institutes gave further proof that Bonn could still meet the tough fiscal targets to qualify for monetary union.

The institutes said in their report that Germany's budget deficit would probably be between 3.0 and 3.2 percent of gross domestic product, either a "point landing" or just over the three percent limit in the Maastricht treaty.
"There must be further clear political signals that the strict observance of the convergence criteria as well as the punctual start of monetary union will not be called into question," Rexrodt said.
Rexrodt also called for quickly carrying out fiscal reforms to make Germany fit for European economic and monetary union (EMU).
